Articles.Content:
I have noticed an error on the FASAFairingsCone1m.cfg part.

Title reads 'PLF - 2.5m to 3.75m Attachment Plate' when i believe is should be 'PLF - 1.25m to 2.5m Attachment Plate'

Description reads 'Attach 3.75m walls to the nodes, in 2x symmetry.' when i believe is should be 'Attach 2.5m walls to the nodes, in 2x symmetry.'

kommitz is working on some of that.

Also, http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/25136-Black-Arrow-British-satellite-launcher

Working is a bit overstated, it hasnt been updated since .18 and it needs a lot of work, such as it only has one exhaust plume for the 1st and second stages, even though they have multiple engines, the first stage runs out of oxidizer before the liquid fuel and IMO needs better texturing

May I say Sir that why in the name of all that is holy did they not get the funding for all these? I mean, combining a Space Shuttle with a Saturn V? Thats genius

The Space Shuttle sucked up all the manned exploration money that NASA had in the late 70s and 80s. They thought the Shuttle would be able to fly more often and thus be cheaper. But it flew ten times less than originally planned (even without the two disasters that halted the Program for 4 years) and thus became as or more expensive as the Saturn V. When you look at all the numbers it's likely that they could've done more with Saturn/Apollo than with the Space Shuttle, for the same amount of money. But you know politics got in the way.

The Space Shuttle sucked up all the manned exploration money that NASA had in the late 70s and 80s. They thought the Shuttle would be able to fly more often and thus be cheaper. But it flew ten times less than originally planned (even without the two disasters that halted the Program for 4 years) and thus became as or more expensive as the Saturn V. When you look at all the numbers it's likely that they could've done more with Saturn/Apollo than with the Space Shuttle, for the same amount of money. But you know politics got in the way.

But still, Saturn V AND Space Shuttle?!?!?! its like putting a Buran on a N1...... excuse me I have to go do this....

speaking of the nose cone it looks like the antenna/guide-thing is on the wrong side of nose cone and does not line up right upside down. its not the biggest problem in the world, but it bugs me to the point i had to say something

love the agena by the way

speaking of the nose cone it looks like the antenna/guide-thing is on the wrong side of nose cone and does not line up right upside down. its not the biggest problem in the world, but it bugs me to the point i had to say something

love the agena by the way

If it's on the wrong side of the nose, then rotate the nose...

If it's on the wrong side of the nose, then rotate the nose...

its built in to the nose

speaking of the nose cone it looks like the antenna/guide-thing is on the wrong side of nose cone and does not line up right upside down. its not the biggest problem in the world, but it bugs me to the point i had to say something

love the agena by the way

Could you show us a pic of what you're talking about? If you're talking about the guide rod on the Gemini Nose, it's supposed to be on the same side as the hatches.
I would really like to see an Apollo mod. All other Apollo mods have been cancelled or or very incomplete.

this is was the top were there were two lines

its been reverced and now it dosent line up right

edit: fixed links

Edited December 22, 2013 by zakkpaz

At least a good Apollo CSM and maybe the LM. The Saturn V is an understandably daunting project. Also the Saturn I or IB would be a nice to have since no mod has a good way to make the Saturn I's first stage.
Frizzak,could you make a blue USAF gemini like the one in this picture please?
Hrm... Not quite sure how the Big G system works... What's your service module supposed to be?

its built in to the nose

EDIT: I think this problem is isolated to you right now, try redownloading.

Hrm... Not quite sure how the Big G system works... What's your service module supposed to be?

In the Science tab there's a big white part with Big G in it. That goes beneath it. Put on thrusters and engines like the stock 24-77 and you're good to go.

In the Science tab there's a big white part with Big G in it. That goes beneath it. Put on thrusters and engines like the stock 24-77 and you're good to go.

Isn't there a docking port on the bottom of that part? Or did you mean radial engines?

I think I found a bug! Hoorah!

In the Agena probe Config, it has the same exact name as the ICBM probe config. name = FASAICBMProbe

I think this might cause some bugs, such as the bug I have where trying to add mechjeb to all command parts won't work for the Agena probe via Module Manager.

I only noticed this because I wanted to add a separate line in my MM config file for the Agena core, and I needed it's name.

Also, for the nosecone problem, it is upside down backwards. I was wondering why it looked so weird. Frizzank, you got some 'splainin to do!

Edited December 22, 2013 by Deltac
Can confirm the FASAICBM thing.

At least a good Apollo CSM and maybe the LM. The Saturn V is an understandably daunting project. Also the Saturn I or IB would be a nice to have since no mod has a good way to make the Saturn I's first stage.

The historic spacecraft mod has a decent Saturn V

I'd say, go for the early designs. Vanguard, Juno I and maybe even Juno II. Explorer 1, maybe some other early sats. Centaur upper stage for Atlas and Titan. There's enough stuff to make without starting an entire new rocket family. Besides, a proper RL-10 not fused with a stage would be a really great addition. Perhaps even the new version, with an extendable nozzle skirt (sort of like what CBBP did for his RD-0146D).
